instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Crashing/RAM issue
threads.message:
Customers kid stepped on it, now it exhibits ram issues, OS crashes spontaneously, memtest throws errors almost immediately.

Board has been inspected carefully, no visible damage, inspected ram chips/area too.

Initially we concluded it was an issue with customers OS install as our external test OS worked fine, a reinstall also worked but customer came back and said it had crashed several times when going into sleep mode.

I recall something about narrowing down what ram chip might be the culprit? Unsure if this was regarding GPU memory but worth asking.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Crashing/RAM issue
threads.message: Very likely broken solders/traces underneath CPU, or RAM...
